inventory.commentary: 13sep06 - updated to WN2.1, added 2 senses (2 and 3), added features, examples. ahouston. 17Dec08 - revised definitions and features. ahouston

sense.name: An official task or undertaking, usually funded
sense.examples: The project to map the human genome took many years and many researchers. The funding agency has decided to go ahead with the pilot project on alternative fuel engines. During the Depression, the public works projects gave work to many unemployed people. John has not yet picked a research project for his senior thesis. (an official stated problem or theme) The town did not have enough left in this year's budget for the downtown beautification project. The agent was assigned to a special project for which he had to go undercover. These town projects are largely operated by unpaid volunteers.

sense.name: a hobby, homemaking crafts and repairs
sense.examples: The magazine describes several Halloween projects to do with children. Putting up the Christmas decorations will be a fun project to do when John and Mary arrive. Sally wants her husband to finish a few of the home improvement projects he started last fall.

sense.name: a low-income, public housing development
sense.examples: Bob grew up in the projects on the south side. No neighborhood seems to want the low-cost housing project in their vicinity. Urban renewal tore down 19th-century houses and apartment buildings and built enormous projects in their place.
